IAction Interface Reference
[ACTION+ Module]

import "actionplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IAction:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Abstraction of an Animation Action.

Definition at line 160 of file actionplus.idl.

Public Member Functions

Subsription
HRESULT Subscribe (IAction *pSubscriber, FWULONG nEvent, FWULONG nFlags, FWULONG nTrigger, FWULONG nId,[out, retval] struct ACTION_SUBS **pHandle)
 Subscribes other actions to events generated by this action.

HRESULT UnSubscribe (FWULONG nTimeStamp, struct ACTION_SUBS *pSubs)
 Unsubscribes an action of a given event.

HRESULT UnSubscribeAll ()
 Unsubscribes all subscribers.

HRESULT GetSubscriptionCount ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the total count of all subscribed actions, if possible user much more efficient IsSubscriptionCount/HasAnySubscriptions function.

FWULONG SubscriptionCount ()
 Returns the total count of all subscribed actions, if possible user much more efficient IsSubscriptionCount/HasAnySubscriptions function.

HRESULT IsSubscriptionCount ()
 S_OK if SubscriptionCount() > 0, S_FALSE otherwise; this function is much more efficient than (Get)SubscriptionCount.

BOOL AnySubscriptionsLeft ()
 same as IsSubscriptionCount, returns TRUE or FALSE (instead of S_OK or S_FALSE)

Action Style
HRESULT SetStyleString (FWSTRING p)
 Sets the Style String; individual styles should be divided with semicolons or spaces, eg. L"left; up".

HRESULT GetStyleString ([out, retval] FWSTRING *p)
 Retrieves the Style String; individual styles are divided with semicolons or spaces, eg. L"left; up".

HRESULT IsStyle (FWSTRING strStyle)
 Returns S_OK if the specified style is present in the object's Style String; S_FALSE otherwise.

Suspend/Resume
HRESULT Suspend (FWULONG nTimeStamp)
 Suspends the action - no events are handled in the Suspend mode (HandleEvent not called).

HRESULT Resume (FWULONG nTimeStamp)
 Resumes after the action life cycle was suspended.

HRESULT IsSuspended ()
 Returns S_OK if the action is in Suspend mode; S_FALSE otherwise.

Time, Phase and Life Cycle Functions
HRESULT SetStartTime (FWULONG nStartTime)
 Sets the time when the action should be started, in miliseconds.

HRESULT GetStartTime ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the time when the action should be started, in miliseconds.

HRESULT GetPeriod ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the period (i.e. completion time), in miliseconds.

HRESULT GetCompleteTime ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the time by the action should be completed, in miliseconds.

FWULONG StartTime ()
 Returns the time when the action should be started, in miliseconds.

FWULONG Period ()
 Returns the period (i.e. completion time), in miliseconds.

FWULONG CompleteTime ()
 Returns the time by the action should be completed, in miliseconds.

HRESULT IsStarted (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 S_OK is returned if the event's time stamp is greater or equal to the Start Time, S_FALSE otherwise.

HRESULT IsOverdue (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 S_OK is returned if the event's time stamp is greater or equal to the Start Time + Period, S_FALSE otherwise.

HRESULT IsMorituri (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 S_OK is returned if the event is to be unsubscribed after handling, S_FALSE otherwise (more).

HRESULT Die (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Sets the action to un-subscribe the provided event just after handling it.

HRESULT GetTime (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent,[out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Returns the current time of action in miliseconds; excludes time when suspended.

HRESULT GetPhase (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent,[out, retval] FWFLOAT *)
 Returns the phase factor [0..1] of the action; Phase = ApplyEnvelope(Time).

FWULONG Time (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Returns the current time of action in miliseconds; excludes time when suspended.

FWFLOAT Phase (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Returns the phase factor [0..1] of the action; Phase = ApplyEnvelope(Time).

HRESULT GetDeltaPhase (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent,[out, retval] FWFLOAT *)
 Returns the delta of the phase factor since the last call: Delta = Phase - PrevPhase (more).

HRESULT GetProgPhase (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent,[out, retval] FWFLOAT *)
 Returns progressive phase, in relation to the time of the previous call (more).

Time Envelope Functions
HRESULT SetSinusoidalEnvelope (FWFLOAT fEaseIn, FWFLOAT fEaseOut)
 Sets sinusoidal motion envelope; ease-in and ease-out to be provided as fractions of one, e.g. (0.1, 0.85).

HRESULT SetParabolicEnvelope (FWFLOAT fEaseIn, FWFLOAT fEaseOut)
 Sets parabolic motion envelope; ease-in and ease-out to be provided as fractions of one, e.g. (0.1, 0.85).

HRESULT SetSinusoidalEnvelopeT (FWULONG timeEaseIn, FWULONG timeEaseOut)
 Sets sinusoidal motion envelope; ease-in and ease-out to be provided in milliseconds from the start of action, e.g. (500, 4500).

HRESULT SetParabolicEnvelopeT (FWULONG timeEaseIn, FWULONG timeEaseOut)
 Sets parabolic motion envelope; ease-in and ease-out to be provided in milliseconds from the start of action, e.g. (500, 4500).

HRESULT SetPhysicalEnvelopeT (FWFLOAT s, FWFLOAT v, FWFLOAT a, FWFLOAT j)
 Sets parabolic motion envelope by providing values for the distance (s), velocity (v), acceleration (a) and jerk (j); use 0 for v, a, or j is not specified.

HRESULT SetNoneEnvelope ()
 Sets no motion envelope (uniform motion).

HRESULT SetEnvelope (enum ACTION_ENVELOPE, FWFLOAT fEaseIn, FWFLOAT fEaseOut)
 Deprecated function: sets either sinusoidal or parabolic envelope.

HRESULT SetEnvelopeEx (struct ACTION_ENVELOPE_DATA *)
 Sets the action envelope: extended version, with keeping at initial and terminating phases.

HRESULT GetEnvelope (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent,[out] struct ACTION_ENVELOPE_DATA *)
 Gets the action envelope description.

HRESULT ApplyEnvelope (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent, FWULONG timeIn, FWULONG timeRef,[out, retval] FWFLOAT *pfOut)
 Applies the envelope to the given value of time; returns a scaled value of 0.0 .. 1.0.

Events
HRESULT HandleEvent (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Handles events sent by a sender action to its subscriber.

HRESULT SendEvent (FWULONG nTimeStamp, FWULONG nEvent, FWULONG nSubCode, FWULONG nReserved)
 Sends event directly to the object.

HRESULT SendEventEx (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Sends event directly to the object.

HRESULT RaiseEvent (FWULONG nTimeStamp, FWULONG nEvent, FWULONG nSubCode, FWULONG nReserved)
 Sends event notification to all the registered subscribers.

HRESULT RaiseEventEx (struct ACTION_EVENT *pEvent)
 Sends event notification to all the registered subscribers.

Callback
HRESULT SetHandleEventHook (HANDLE_EVENT_HOOK_FUNC pfHook, FWULONG nParam, void *pParam)

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IAction::IsMorituri (  struct ACTION_EVENT *  pEvent  ) 
 

S_OK is returned if the event is to be unsubscribed after handling, S_FALSE otherwise (more).

S_OK value is returned if either of these conditions if fulfilled:

  • event is subscribed with ACTION_ONCE flag,
  • the Die function has been called,
  • event is subscribed with ACTION_AUTO flag, and the event's time stamp is greater or equal than Start Time + Period.

HRESULT IAction::GetDeltaPhase (  struct ACTION_EVENT *  pEvent,
[out, retval] FWFLOAT * 
) 
 

Returns the delta of the phase factor since the last call: Delta = Phase - PrevPhase (more).

The "last call" time is measured since the previous call to either GetDeltaPhase or GetProgPhase; Avoid using both GetDeltaPhase and GetProgPhase in the same action and call one of these actions exactly once in every animation cycle, when appropriate. Otherwise additional calls could affect the "last call time". Subject to the envelope settings.

HRESULT IAction::GetProgPhase (  struct ACTION_EVENT *  pEvent,
[out, retval] FWFLOAT * 
) 
 

Returns progressive phase, in relation to the time of the previous call (more).

ProgPhase = (Time - TimePrev) / (Period - TimePrev). The "last call" time is measured since the previous call to either GetDeltaPhase or GetProgPhase; Avoid using both GetDeltaPhase and GetProgPhase in the same action and call one of these actions exactly once in every animation cycle, when appropriate. Otherwise additional calls could affect the "last call time". Subject to the envelope settings.
